His work represents the philosophical tradition of systematic theorizing about mind, knowledge, and human nature that characterized 19th-century philosophical psychology. 11172403#Agent600-21.rationale: This catalog entry is for a Japanese work titled 'Yomitsugareru shiki: Shiba Sen no denki bungaku' (読み継がれる史記: 司馬遷の伝記文学) by Taniguchi Tadashi, which translates to 'The Records of the Grand Historian that Continue to be Read: Sima Qian's Biographical Literature.' The work focuses on Sima Qian (司馬遷, c. 145-86 BCE), the famous Chinese historian and author of the Shiji (史記, Records of the Grand Historian). The subject headings indicate this is a study of 'Chinese literature--To 221 B.C.--History and criticism' and specifically examines Sima Qian's Shi ji as biographical literature, with additional focus on 'Japanese literature--Chinese influences.' The primary classification is Literature and Narrative Arts because the work analyzes Sima Qian's historical writing as 'denki bungaku' (biographical literature), treating his historical work through a literary lens and examining its literary qualities and influence. The secondary classification is History, Heritage, and Memory because Sima Qian was fundamentally a historian whose Shiji is one of China's most important historical works, and the study examines how this historical text has been preserved and transmitted ('yomitsugareru' - continues to be read) across cultures and time periods.
